_header: Thou that has cast three sixes here
Note:
Cf. More (1540)
XMore, Sir Thomas. The Boke of the Fayre Gentylwoman…Lady Fortune. London: Robert Wyer, 1540 (STC 18078.5), trans. of Le livre de passetemps de la Fortune des Dez.
_description: Divination by means of dice — in quatrains, one for each possible combination of three dice

BLSl513.First Lines:
þu þat hast y cast tre syses hereþu schalt haue
                    þy desere þis same ȝere…
BLSl513.Last Lines:
…he þat syȝe trey & as haþ takeyn his
                    workes wisily doþ wake…
BLSl513.Note:
74 lines only; ends with first two lines for combination
                    6-3-1.

AbeUL123.First Lines:
Thow þat has cast iij sixes hereShalt have þy desyre
                    þis same ȝere…
AbeUL123.Last Lines:
…þou canst þy love as privily kepewyþe hur
                    byrdys when men hem seche…
AbeUL123.Editions:
Tweedie,  Michael G. 
             “An astrogalantic poem of the fifteenth century.” 
         M.Litt thesis. University of Aberdeen, 1973.

YaleBei365.First Lines:
…Schall haue ȝowre dessyer þis same ȝerhold
                    ȝow stabyll and ware nowȝt…
YaleBei365.Last Lines:
…Be trew and trost in mary myldand sche wyll ȝow fro
                    schame schyld…
YaleBei365.Note:
Fragment: 95 lines only, missing first line; ends with 5-5-3
                    cast.
YaleBei365.Editions:
Smith,  Lucy Toulmin,
                        ed.  
             A Commonplace Book of the Fifteenth Century.
         Norwich: Kerrison, Goose, 1886: 15-18.
Smith,  Lucy Toulmin,
                        ed.  
             “Notes on A Common-Place Book of the Fifteenth Century with a Religious
                Play of Abraham and Isaac.” 
             The Norfolk Antiquarian Miscellany.
            Walter Rye, ed. 
         3 vols. Norwich: Goose & Co, 1873-87: 3.115-67: 150-2.

BosPLMed100.First Lines:
Þai þat has castin iii sisses hereSal haue þi
                    dissire þis sam yhereHald þe stabil & wari þou
                    noghtfor þou sal haue þi dissir þat is in þi
                    thoght…
BosPLMed100.Last Lines:
…Þou has casted thre acys on rawI rede þou lar god
                    to knaw& prai ihesu of his special graceat þou myght se hym
                    in his face
BosPLMed100.Note:
Complete: 224 lines written as 56 quatrains, with illustrations of the
                    dice to right of each quatrain.
BosPLMed100.Facsimiles:
Ives,  S. A. 
             “An Unpublished Piece of Medieval English Folklore.” 
             Rare Books: Notes on the History of Old Books and
                Manuscripts…Together with Catalogue No. 22.
            H. P. Kraus, ed. 
         (1942): 4 (facsim. of f. 84v).
BosPLMed100.Editions:
Ives,  S. A. 
             “An Unpublished Piece of Medieval English Folklore.” 
             Rare Books: Notes on the History of Old Books and
                Manuscripts…Together with Catalogue No. 22.
            H. P. Kraus, ed. 
         (1942): 6-7 (first 10 quatrains only).
